WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi,

I'm closing this work item as this is no longer an issue in Prism. For additional support regarding this subject, you could create a thread in the discussions section (http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions), where we will help you with your concerns.

Thanks,

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
WorkItem.Description: Silverlight Navigation is a very interesting feature, however there is no support for it in Prism. Some people have tried to use navigation in Prism (see http://blogs.southworks.net/mconverti/2009/04/12/how-to-integrate-a-prism-v2-application-with-the-silverlight-3-navigation-framework/), but ran into several limitations. I would really like to see proper support for navigation in the next version of Prism.

Comments.Message:
Have a look at this post, see if it helps:
http://www.codeproject.com/KB/silverlight/sl3prismnav.aspx

Regards
Navigation in PRISM is still an issue, please reconsider your assignments

Hi,

It could be useful to now that, as of today, Prism is more integrated with the Silverlight Navigation Framework. You could check the following post from Karl Shifflett, which explains how this is used along with Region Navigation:

http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kashiffl/archive/2010/10/05/integrating-prism-v4-region-navigation-with-silverlight-frame-navigation.aspx

I hope you find this helpful.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blog.southworks.net/gmaliandi
